DOC.brief_title: The Effect Avocado Cardiovascular Disease ( CVD ) Risk Factors
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized , 3-period cross-over , control feeding study design compare effect moderate fat blood cholesterol-lowering diet provide one avocado per day ( total fat = 34 % total energy , MUFA=18 % , SFA < 7 % ) Average American diet ( AAD ) , Lower-Fat diet ( total fat = 24 % total energy , SFA < 7 % ) , Moderate Fat diet ( equivalent fatty acid profile avocado diet ) without avocado . The study population consist 40 overweight ( BMI25-35 kg/m2 ) men woman moderately elevate LDL-C , the25-90th percentile NHANES . The investigator hypothesize moderate fat heart-healthy diet , include 1 avocado per day reduce CVD risk factor include lipid , lipoprotein , apolipoproteins , lipoprotein particle size , marker oxidative stress inflammation , blood pressure reverse cholesterol transport compare AAD , Lower-Fat diet , moderate fat diet without avocado .
DOC.criteria: healthy nonsmoking overweight ( BMI 2535 kg/m2 ) men woman LDLC the2590th percentile NHANES : 105194mg/dL male ; 98190mg/dL female ) BP > 140/90 mmHg ; A history myocardial infarction , stroke , diabetes mellitus , liver disease , kidney disease , thyroid disease ( unless control medication ) ; Lactation , pregnancy , desire become pregnant study ; Cholesterollowering medication use ; Intake putative cholesterollowering supplement ( psyllium , fish oil capsule , soy lecithin , niacin , fiber , flax , phytoestrogens , stanol/sterol supplement food ) ; Vegetarianism ; Nut allergy ( Other food allergy review casebycase basis ) ; Refusal discontinue nutritional supplement , herb vitamin
